Articles.Content: One of the most impressive collections of missions (if not *the* most impressive) comes from Mendahu. On his website he recreates real world missions and pieces together an incredible overview of spaceflight. The collection currently spans 160 parts, from the V-2 to the first Ariane 4 launch, and from NASA to the SSP. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re interested in learning about humanityÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s history in spaceflight, this is the place to start! Check out the [http://www.ksphistory.com/](**website**!

This is awesome. A must-read for... well... anyone, really.

11/10 ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Much like what Mulbin did but I must note it misses a lot of launches. But then again it is incredibily hard to keep focus in KSP.....Good work!
I'm learning as crap-ton reading though this, it's great! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
I'm glad everyone enjoys this! Special thanks to Squad for bringing some traffic to the site. I post primarily through Reddit, so be sure to check out the discussions there!

Just mind blowing! ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Can't possibly give you enough rep for your achievements...
Very awesome. I've found myself slowly looking through all of them (I'm at #36); thanks for making these.

This was really neat. His stock part replicas just gave me a bunch of design ideas! 

Check out Bob Fitch's YouTube series Alexandria, he does historical launches also. With TONS of mods!

One of the few reasons I post in the subreddit.

Awesome as ever.
